movieReview: This was my favorite Bond film so far, I'm pretty sure I'd seen this one before...  The Bond gimmick shit is starting to get a little overboard by this film, and the dubbing of foreign actors and sped-up footage during action scenes is a bit tired, but pretty engaging from start to finish.  Also by far my favorite theme song so far.

This movie didn't sit all that well with me...  All of the Asian "characters" seemed thin and stereotypical, and the whole gimmick of Bond becoming a Ninja was ridiculous.  All that said, the big showdown at the end in the Volcano was pretty great and the way they downplayed finally showing Blofeld was perfect...  He just leans forward to introduce himself.  Pretty sure I hadn't seen this one, I don't see how I could forget Bond training as a Ninja.
WAAAAAY too long... It was OK, but would have been better had it been shorter..
This was definitely a more serious Bond movie, but it was too long and boring at times...  Lazenby did an OK job, but overall this was a misguided script and film.

Series is definitely suffering diminishing returns...  There was some completely ridiculous shit in this movie (the whole Moon Rover sequence?  The burial in the pipe??  I fear this is only going to get worse as I move into Roger Moore territory.
Possibly more racist than You Only Live Twice and even hokier than Diamonds are Forever...  Pretty bad overall.
Not great but pretty good and lots of fun.  Took awhile to get going but got bananaballs as it went on.  Downton Abbey dude played a great psycho.  Also some Front 242 on the soundtrack.

Pretty freakin bad...  I love Christopher Lee but he was a pretty lame Bond villain..  And Herve Villechaize was horrible.  Britt Eckland was as gorgeous as always but her character was horribly written.  Goofy and hokey and dumb.  The worst Bond movie so far.
movieTitle: The Man With The Golden Gun

movieReview: A great doc about something I hadn't heard of before:  Bing Russell bringing back independent baseball to Portland Oregon...

By a mile the best Roger Moore Bond film so far.  Up there with the better Connery films..  Opening ski sequence was a little hokey, as was the underwater car sequence, but much of that could be to Chromakey that doesn't hold up so well to the modern eye.  I'd seen this one but not in ages.  Barely remembered it.
Coco suggested we watch this again and I jumped at the opportunity as I had been thinking about rewatching it myself.  I really lvoe this movie.
A pretty darned good movie.  Did a great job of communication tension and violence.
Horrible.  So bad...  A fucking Gondola that secretly is motorized and also can secretly transform into a fucking hovercraft.  And that is like the 5th most ridiculous thing in the movie.
Much better than Moonraker.  Pretty enjoyable, not very hokey (other than the Hockey scene and cheesy Maggie Thatcher impersonator), action was fun though Skiing scenes are getting a little old.
The most boring and drawn out Bond film so far...   Felt like it went on forever...
Still fucking awesome

Really bad...  Yet another skiing action set-piece had my rolling my eyes and then it turned into an even more laughable snowboarding set piece.  Set to CALIFORNIA GIRLS, but they were too cheap to actually license the real Beach Boys  recording so it was a shitty soundalike version..
It was ok..   would have been so much better if it had actually dealt with the aftermath and treatment of his PTSD in a substantial way.
Such a refreshing change of pace after some really awful Roger Moore films.  This film confirmed my vague fond remberance of Dalton being a great Bond.
A little too sparse and slow, but still quite good.  Good performances from the 3 leads.
Bleh.  Very bleh.  Passive character makes idiotic decisions and doesn't really suffer any consequences.
Very heavy...
Meh...  seemed stretched out and was more about the relationship than her quest to resume her acting career...
Super interesting doc by Jon Ronson who was given access to spelunk the vast archives of Stanley Kubrick
Good enough look at LA's New Beverley cinema and the feared-death of 35mm projection.
OK, but a little too inside baseball at times...  Also verged on "Record Store Employee" from time to time, but I guess that shouldn't be a surprise given the subject matter.
movieTitle: We Want The Airwaves: The WFNX Story

movieReview: I didn't remember this film at all, though I'm pretty certain I saw it...  007 going rogue was an interesting conceit, though I don't think they did much with it...  It might have been better if MI6 was shown trying to stop him, but it kind of seemed like the whole notion of him going rogue was never committed to.

Really hard to understand the accent of some of the characters, but you could still follow the overall plot without necessariliy understanding the specific dialog of some scenes.  More-or-less "The Raid: Ireland"
Fascinating look at a very weird set of circumstances....
An ok look at modern pile-on criticism of 'edgy' comedy.  The soundtrack is atrocious, though...
A very nice profile of Big Papi and all of his accomplishments.
A fantastic documentary, possibly the best character Errol Morris has ever explored..  How someone with a scientific mind can be tricked by bad science.
movieTitle: Mr. Death: The Rise and Fall of Fred A. Leuchter, Jr.

movieReview: An enjoyable, but dark, war film.  Almost feels like a throwback to movies that aren't made anymore, but that could also just be due to the WW2 setting.  Difficult to separate Pitt from his Inglorious Basterds character.
Weird but interesting, definitely proto-Morris...
Another step in the evolution of Errol Morris...  Simple, straightforward interviews with real people who are just a touch unusual.  Could have come off like 'laughing at the hillbillies' but didn't.

Perhaps one of the Tom Cruisest movies ever...  Still fun, though very 80s.  Lots of great actors in the cast..  I had forgotten John C. Reilly was in it, and of course Rooker and Elwes, but even Margo Martindale was in there (though I don't think it was a speaking role) and the actor who plays "Art" on Justified...
Good, not great.  Felt drawn out and the characters all seemed like ciphers.
movieTitle: A Girl Walks Home Alone At Night

movieReview: Strangely similar quality wise to "A Girl Walks Home.." with similar problems..  Felt too long and stretched out.  Some beautiful shots, and it wasn't BAD, but not my favorite.

Lots of review for a longtime internet nerd like myself who remembers Scientology's war on the internet and Operation Clambake...  Must have really blown the minds of people who were completely ignorant of Scientology.
movieTitle: Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief

movieReview: A sub-par remake of Point Break.  I have been told the series gets way better, but I wanted to refresh myself before I dove in.
Fairly mediocre action movie.  Paul Walker is horrible.  Dialogue was atrocious..  But fun visually and the action scenes were well directed.
Hooboy this was a pretty bad movie.  And to think they managed to find a dumbface actor WORSE than Paul Walker..
movieTitle: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift

movieReview:
By far the best of the series so far.  Well scripted and very well directed.  Moved fast and blurred some of the worst of Walker's acting enough so it wasn't a sore thumb.

Some really weird shit in this movie tho.  Walker's Brian is suddenly an FBI agent, not LAPD?  Dom is some kind of car crash Dexter, CSIing Letty's crash scene?
Even better than 4.  One or two headscratcher scenes, but overall a great heist flick.  Nice evolution of the series.

Pretty freakin good...  Not as good as 5 but probably second best.  The whole amnesia subplot was kinda dumb, and that was the longest runway ever, but if you start nitpicking these movies you're doing it wrong.
Great film...  I had heard great things about this but had never seen it before.  Reminded me that Travolta can be good...
Not very good.  Lots of talking and action scenes were over the top, even for a movie from this series.
Still quite good.  Definitely some eyeroll-y shit at times, and Nolan is often style over substance.  But I like the style.

Brosnan isn't the worst Bond (Moore), but the whole tone of this is off...  It's got a ton of the goofy Moore-esque shit, but it also seems to have no idea how to deal with a post-Soviet world...  All of the Russian characters (save Natalya) are really pretty bad.  And while I do love Famke Jannsen, Xenia Onatopp really is ridiculous.  I remembered liking this movie when it came out, but this just wasn't terribly good.

Yawn....  I'm not sure if Brosnan is bad, but these movies sure are...  Action setpieces are dumb and cheap looking...  Camerawork is boring and even amateurish at times, and the script has too many corny jokes and one liners...
Good, perhaps not as good as the previous two but enjoyable.  Definitely not for everyone.
Better than I expected, but still pretty bad.  The action setpieces were all pretty lame.  The bat-boat at the beginning was awful.  And Denise Richards was so miscast.
Very good sci-fi.  Not a revelatory plot but very well made and well conceived.

Meh.  That is all there really is to say.  The early parts were Bond is in captivity could have been more interesting but were handled mostly with a montage.  The rest of it was either fairly generic Bond or really over the top gadgets and setpieces that felt like Bond-By-Numbers

I don't really know much about David Foster Wallace, other than never getting into INFINITE JEST.  But this movie was pretty great.  Jason Segel with a great performance and a script that was mostly drawn from actual interview conversations...
Lots of fun, engaging interviews, great footage, and well cut.
Amazing behind the scenes interviews of active investigations.  Really calls into question the actions of the FBI.
An interesting doc about the stereotype of the "gay" affectation.  Many things I hadn't thought of before.
Was captivating.  2+ hours, no spoken dialog, no subtitles, all sign language. (It's no Deafula, though :)
A portrait of an interesting man who is also a Vietnam vet dealing with PTSD as well as trying to make a life.
A great look at the misogyny in video gaming culture.  Behavior like this makes me ashamed to call myself a gamer.
Really good. A look at some complicated legal and civic questions.
Bobcat's doc was fantastic.  One of the best movies I've seen all year...
A ton of dumb fun!  Metalheads bring upon a demonic apocalypse and metalheads try to save the world.
A fun doc profiling 4 great DJs. A bit quickly intercut for me but quite interesting.
A bit convenient but still had some really great scenes and performances.
A very powerful companion to THE ACT OF KILLING. Adi is so amazingly brave.
A fairly standard rock-doc about a fairly non-standard band.  Lots of fun, though this kind of doc is right in my wheelhouse...
movieTitle: Theory of Obscurity: A Film About the Residents

movieReview: Not my cup of tea... Weak acting and weird directorial choices.
Pretty standard doc, a little long.  Would have preferred some more info on the story of the various strips they were discussing, as I only knew Judge Dredd.
A good, entertaining film with great performances.
movieTitle: I'll See You In My Dreams

movieReview: Fascinating and riveting.  This movie is going to blow minds.
Nice teen drama, great way to end IFFBoston 2015
movieTitle: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl

movieReview: Perfectly good action movie.  I think it required a bit too much fanboy knowledge for it to really work...
Amusing, but not amazing.
movieTitle: What We Do In The Shadows

movieReview: Heartwrenching.
Fine period romantic drama.
Right in line with government/police overreactions such as Waco and Ruby Ridge...  Except this time the cops dropped a bomb from the air.  In Philadelphia.  Insane.
Fuck.  Yes.  A Masterpiece.
On one hand, a well made doc.  On the other hand, the Carroll's actual story is pretty straight forward and vanilla.
movieTitle: I Am Big Bird: The Caroll Spinney Story

movieReview: In honor of Towel Day I spun this up again...  Not sure I had watched it since it was released a decade ago.  It's a pretty good adaptation, and I don't really mind the tweaks to the story...
Tons of nostalgia..  Better than I expected a several hour documentary on this subject to be.
A whole lot more setup before the murder than I expected..  Kinda felt pretty long given a pretty simple plot.
As bad as it's reputation indicated.  Just horrible in almost every way.
What a bunch of cunts.  Turns out if you throw all of the egos together nothing good comes out of it.
movieTitle: Lost Soul: The Doomed Journey of Richard Stanley's Island of Dr. Moreau

movieReview: A good movie, not great, but some awesome cinematography and some good performances.
If you are familiar with Tobolowsky's storytelling this will be familiar, if not, you're in for a treat.
A fair look at the complex subject of Silk Road, the Dread Pirate Roberts and Ross Ulbrecht
Fine... Probably the best sequel of JP, but that isn't saying much.
Beautiful and fascinating, and this is coming from someone who doesn't care too much for Sushi.  Though, I'd certainly try Jiro's. ;)
Watched this fairly recently but some friends were over and wanted to see it, so who am I to argue?  Still great.
A little over the top, a little unintentionally funny, and a little good.
Proving that I can watch a documentary about anything, I watched this...  It was pretty super long..
movieTitle: Quiet Riot: Well Now You're Here, There's No Way Back

movieReview: Great profile of an Amazing man.
I would pay big money to see Nicholas Cage be Superman.  This is as close as I'm going to get, I suspect.
movieTitle: The Death of "Superman Lives": What Happened?

movieReview: Super, super depressing...  Humans are all awful.
A little long, esp. in the setup, but good fun.
Pretty darned good.  Built nice and slow and built such a creepy mood...
Fun;  Much better than you'd expect from a movie entitled "Ant-Man".
Fairly standard Liam Neeson Kills Everyone film.  Not great, but fine.
Pretty fun romcom....  Some parts didn't work, probably could have shed ~20m...  But funny.
Solid action, fairly tight, fun... Dunno if I'll remember much of it in a week, but I had a great time.
Fairly pedestrian coverage of the creation of TNG... Not great.
movieTitle: William Shatner Presents: Chaos on the Bridge

movieReview: Tig is such a strong woman, this was a great profile of the turmoil of her past few years.
One of the classics I had never seen...  It's classic for a reason.
Still really good... In fact, the second viewing seemed tighter;  I blame festival delerium.
Funny, but she's been better...
Terrible.
Still fuckin awesome.
BLACK MASS was a movie.  It was fine. Depp did a really good job, contacts were unnecessary though.
Good documentary profiling some super funny people...
movieTitle: Drunk Stoned Brilliant Dead: The Story of the National Lampoon

movieReview: Great distillation of the book while keeping all of the good parts and themes in a tight movie.  A++
Covers a lot of ground I already knew, but some good interviews and a fairly good overview of the history of SNL.
Ok... too slow, felt kinda of like a high-budget exploitation movie... Mexploitation?
Pretty standard ghost movie.  Nothing terribly original, but pretty and well put together.
Good, kinda mid-level Spielberg which means it's a very good movie.
Easily Michael Moore's least cynical movie...
This is a strange, absurd road-trip movie about a very difficult comic.  Definitely not for everyone.
No comment necessary.
No comment necessary.
No comment necessary.
Quite good, though for some reason the poker scenes feel super-dated now.
A fuckin' mess...
Pretty good, though I'm not certain it's a James Bond movie.  He basically fails at everything and looks like an idiot most of the movie.
Good, not great.  Probably the most "James Bond" movie of the Daniel Craig era.  Perhaps a little TOO "James Bond Formula" though..  Definitely 15-20m too long...
Darned good.  Kept surprising me all the way to the end, and not in a cheap-feeling way.
Great newsroom drama and a great picture of Boston (the good and bad).  The church continues to disgust.
Finally got to see this movie I Kickstarted years ago...  Fortunately, it was worth the wait... :)
Talk about diminishing returns...  Too long and too boring.  Felt like a chore after awhile.
Good, though a remake of Rocky was not really necessary.  Good performances from MBJ and Stallone.

I hadn't seen this in a long time, and boy is it bad at parts.  Other than the Jedi shit at the open, the first 30 minutes is a slog.  There are just so many misguided parts in it.  That final lightsaber battle is still great, though.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace

movieReview: While I think that Episode I has worse components, I think it is possible that this film is more /boring/.  I found myself completely tuned out at parts.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones

movieReview: Probably the best of the 3 prequels, but still tons of issues.  The dialogue is all too forced and the performances lacking.  It's also too long and as a prequel, you know exactly where the story is going so it all kind of feels like an exercise.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith

movieReview: I've heard bits and pieces about this book but have never gotten around to reading it.  This movie not only made me want to read it, but also to re/visit all of HItchcock's work.
Still fantastic, and so much better than the prequels...
People like to argue whether Star Wars or Empire is the best, but it doesn't really matter.  They are both great, if different movies.
This movie has issues but has a fond place in my heart...  It's probably the Star Wars movie I've seen the most.
What a relief!  This movie was great;  tons of fun, exciting, with tons of action and some very well-formed and fun characters.  Can't wait to see it again.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens

movieReview: I don't know why I'm so fascinated by Disney parks when I hate being at them so much, but it is what it is.  This had some interesting behind the scenes footage as well as interviews with some interesting people in the "Dark Disney" community.
Ok, but not great.  Better for a 'lazy cable afternoon' than a theatre.

Still great the second time!  I saw this a second time so quickly because i had the day off and I really wanted to check out the new 4K Laser IMAX projection, which is only installed at 7 US theatres.  It looked gorgeous.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens

movieReview: Wow, this was horrendous.   The series has always played it fast and loose with logic, but this one was cuckoo bananas.
Still really good.  Glad it finally came out on video.  Sort of.
A yearly tradition, still fantastic.
Merry Christmas.  Shitter's Full.
And this thing that tells time.
Really boring in parts, and at times felt like fanfic trying to 'undo the sins of X-Men 3'..  But entertaining enough.  Can't say I'm terribly excited for the next installment, though
Still great the THIRD time.. :)  This time was a Digital 2D screening, and as nice as Laser IMAX 3D was, 2D still is the way to go...
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens
